topic.title: Cryptocurrency distribution as a gift
topic.body:
Select a key and get coins

https://github.com/starwels/BOUNTY/releases

Bounty will work a couple of months

Install wallet here https://github.com/starwels/starwels/releases

1560002823_1Fdubdz82XUxNMuaHGYC3uKD95Xbn.body:
> [andax](#comment_6_1D8TYfuxwgwt6q3Qf5fKNDqFH1ztqJfZaH): How could i do that? Im a cryptocurrency n00b but have a wallet. When i try "open file" one of these 4 wallet.dat with Electrum, it complains:ErrorCannot load wallet (1):'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xa9 in position 32:invalid start byte

You can not use Electrum

> [reeeeeeeeeeeeeee](#comment_1_1MutjWS9dBUHWpg67kCVznJn2uG3z4n8Rr): So how does this cryptocurrency differ from Bitcoin? The link to the "original whitepaper" in the Starwels Github is just a link to Satoshi's Bitcoin whitepaper.

There is a very important advantage here - the speed of transactions and the preservation of decentralization.

> [reeeeeeeeeeeeeee](#comment_2_1MutjWS9dBUHWpg67kCVznJn2uG3z4n8Rr): How does Starwels speed up transactions and preserve decentralization versus Bitcoin?

Blocks move in seconds one second new block

> [reeeeeeeeeeeeeee](#comment_6_1MutjWS9dBUHWpg67kCVznJn2uG3z4n8Rr): How does Starwels prevent double spending if transactions are instantaneous?

It works like bitcoin, but mining only for a commission.
p2pool: http://91.240.86.126:9342/static/

Download bfgminer
https://github.com/luke-jr/bfgminer
http://bfgminer.org/files/stable/

how to do mining on windows
> bfgminer.exe -o stratum+tcp://91.240.86.126:9342 -u Your wallet -p USDH -S opencl:auto

You can also run your own p2pool.


>  sudo apt-get update
> sudo apt-get upgrade
> sudo apt-get install build-essential libtool autotools-dev automake pkg-config libssl-dev libevent-dev bsdmainutils
> sudo apt-get install libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-program-options-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev
> sudo add-apt-repository ppa:bitcoin/bitcoin
> sudo apt-get update
> sudo apt-get install libdb4.8-dev libdb4.8++-dev
> sudo apt-get install libminiupnpc-dev
> sudo apt-get install libzmq3-dev
> sudo apt-get install libqt5gui5 libqt5core5a libqt5dbus5 qttools5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler
> sudo apt-get install libqrencode-dev

> sudo wget https://github.com/starwels/starwels/releases/download/v0.15.4/starwels-0.15.4.tar.gz

> tar -xvzf starwels-0.15.4.tar.gz
> cd starwels-0.15.4

> ./autogen.sh
> ./configure
> make
> sudo make install

Stat the file with daemon flag so that you can create a config file

Create a conf file in .starwels/starwels.conf

> cd
> sudo nano .starwels/starwels.conf

listen=1
txindex=1
rpcuser=testus
rpcpassword=testpass

> /usr/local/bin/starwelsd -daemon
Check it daemon has started.  If it returns information, the daemon is working!



> git clone https://github.com/hardincorporated/p2pool
> sudo apt-get install python-zope.interface python-twisted python-twisted-web
> sudo apt-get install python-argparse

> python run_p2pool.py

> [necrophcodr](#comment_2_1Mcuc9PBJGnBgYr2SMeLePxipeuETyzkLg): This is clearly a scam. No where is there any information available on how this improves anything, only bringing more questions than answers with blanket statements such as being "faster". So how is it faster then? In technical terms?

No, this is not a scam you can get coins for free and give to a friend. How technology works I can advise you to look at the source code if you understand the technical part.

> [0din](#comment_3_16GG19wZtGAcebcKhf2hEmcf1sETig7DLA): And how it is based on Bitcoin, faster blocks == +orphans

Internet speed and SSD allow using such speed
